verses.roman:
keha kona prasāda āni' deya govinda-ṭhāñi
'ihā yena avaśya bhakṣaṇa karena gosāñi'

synonyms: keha—someone; kona prasāda—some variety of prasāda; āni'-bringing; deya—delivers; govinda-ṭhāñi—to Govinda; ihā—this; yena—that; avaśya—certainly; bhakṣaṇa karena—eats; gosāñi—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu.
translation: Each devotee would bring a certain type of prasāda. He would entrust it to Govinda and request him, "Please arrange that the Lord will surely eat this prasāda."
